creator: car3less1
title: 3D Printed Business Cards
materials_required: Digital modeling software (3D Studio Max, Rhinoceros, Catia, Autocad, SketchUp, blender or similar)
3D printer (or access to such a service)
Laser cutter and engraver (or access to such a service)
Transparent Plexiglas Acrylic sheet (3 mm thick)
description: This project details how to create unique 3D printed business cards by combining laser cutting & engraving with 3D printing. The cards feature a 3D printed frame and decorative element, along with a laser-cut and engraved acrylic insert for displaying contact information. The design allows for easy replacement of individual parts.
steps: Sketch the design, considering keywords like services, quality, materials, utility, uniqueness, connection to the event, and price. Combine 3D printed parts with Plexiglas acrylic parts that can be independent and changed as desired, and include a theme.
Design the acrylic part using CorelDRAW (or Autocad) and prepare files for laser cutting and engraving. Ensure contact details and margins are on different layers/colors.

Model the 3D printed parts, including a 3-sided frame with an H profile to hold the acrylic part, and a decorative slider that can be inserted into the frame. Consider 3D printing tolerances for proper fitting.
Prepare the 3D model for printing ensuring it is one mesh. Verify and correct the mesh using software like Netfabb.
Assemble the parts by sliding the acrylic sheet into the 3D printed frame and sliding the decoration into the outside of the frame. Adjustments may be needed based on tolerances.
The stl files are available for PERSONAL USE only and ready to print.
